{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3552807,"name":"Fatuma ","username":"Fatumat","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fatumat/{size}/240770_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-10T15:44:17.695Z","cooked":"

Hello, this is my first time programming our new radio after a competition and I am having an issue where it wont get a connection. I can’t get a signal on the configuration webpage.

  1. The firmware is up to date
  2. It is able to connect through network assistant tool
  3. I am able to connect to the robot through the driver station team number being the robo rio. (Not exactly sure what this means)
  4. When conecting to the radio by ethernet or wifi I get the errors such as
Errors

Warning ﻿﻿ 44002 ﻿﻿ Ping Results: ﻿link-bad﻿, DS radio(.4)-GOOD﻿, robot radio(.1)-bad﻿, roboRIO(.2)-bad﻿, FMS-bad﻿﻿ Driver Station

and

ERROR ﻿﻿ -44019 ﻿﻿ FRC: The mDNS service is slow to respond. Check firewall settings. ﻿﻿ Driver Station

Screenshots

Screenshot 2025-03-10 110035799×268 53.6 KB

Not exactly how to proceed from here. Any help is appreciated, thank you.

Looks like the team number is not set on your roboRIO.
Here is the documentation for setting your team number.

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

roboRIO Team Number Setter

roboRIO Team Number Setter tool. The roboRIO Team Number Setter is a cross-platform utility that can be used to set the team number on the roboRIO. It is an alternative to the roboRIO imaging tool ...

ALSO
Your VH-109 robot radio is configured as an access point.
You will want to configure it as a ROBOT RADIO instead.
TEAM ACCESS POINT mode is for when you have a second VH-109 connected to your computer bridging to the VH-109 on the robot.

Hello,

Thank you for your response. I have done both, changing the team number and radio mode. However I am running into the same issue. I am able to conect over wifi, however the team number still wont show. I am unable to deploy code either. The robot can connect still, and I can run the robot on the code the rio last had deployed. Not sure how to proceed. The radio is up to date and I can’t get a signal on the configure robot radio page.

Screenshots

Screenshot 2025-03-11 105552771×170 38.8 KB

The reason this worked: we noticed in your second screenshot of the driverstation that the robot RIO IP was 10.TE.AM.200 (still, it was 10.TE.AM.201 earlier/yesterday).

It should be 10.TE.AM.2

So we still knew the team number was not yet properly set and the robot radio did not know who the robotRIO was in order to give it the correct IP address via DHCP.
